intro: Melandrium platyphyllum f. involucrata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved catchfly, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers with five petals. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The species is notable for its unique floral morphology and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
